title: 'They were a disgrace': Jamie Carragher SLAMS Southampton after Leicester humiliation
text:
Jamie Carragher labelled Southampton's performance as 'disgraceful and shocking' following their 9-0 pummeling at the hands of Leicester at St Mary's on Friday night.

Hat-tricks from Ayoze Perez and Jamie Vardy, alongside goals by Ben Chilwell, Youri Tielemans and James Maddison, meant the Foxes were in dreamland on the south coast while it was something of a nightmare for Ralph Hasenhuttl's Saints.

The Southampton manager called it a 'no-performance' afterwards, and former Liverpool defender Carragher went in on the home team's display, and feared for them ahead of a double-header at Manchester City next week.

Jamie Carragher was highly critical of Southampton's home performance on Friday evening

Pierre-Emile Hojbjerg apologises to the supporters following the nine-goal humiliation

‘Shocking. I felt sorry for them in some ways,' Carragher told Sky Sports' Friday Night Football.

‘Some of those players there were a disgrace really. You don’t see 9-0. What is the backbone in this team?

'A disgraceful performance – that’s one of the worst performances of any team in Premier League history.'

It doesn't get any easier for the stricken Saints, with a Carabao Cup tie at Manchester City on Tuesday followed by another game against the champions at the Etihad next Saturday.

Leicester's Jamie Vardy (centre) notched a hat-trick, as did team-mate Ayoze Perez (right)

'Their confidence will be absolutely shot,' Carragher continued.

'You fear for them going there [at City]. They go there and if they get beat 4-0, they’ll be happy. They'l be thinking, "please don’t embarrass ourselves again."'

Ex-Manchester United defender Gary Neville was equally critical of Southampton's torrid display.

Sky Sports duo Carragher and Neville gave a damning verdict of Southampton's display

‘It’s a system of play that if you’re not good at it you’ll be beat badly,' Neville explained. ‘You look at Southampton and they look so fragile. There’s a couple of young players who will need taking out after that game.

‘There’s no excuse for some of them. The stadium must have had 5-6,000 at the end.

'He needs to give them a couple days away. I’ve had a defeat like that in Spain, it’s hard.'
description: Ralph Hasenhuttl called it a 'no-performance' afterwards, and Carragher went in on the home team's display, and feared for them ahead of a double-header at Man City next week.
